alert.note: Alert for Creek; Okmulgee; Tulsa (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 13 at 9:15AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Creek, northwestern Okmulgee and south central Tulsa Counties through 945 AM CDT... At 914 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 4 miles north of Slick, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Sapulpa... Jenks... Glenpool... Kiefer... Mounds... Kellyville... Slick... Liberty... This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 193 and 215. A 54 mph wind gust was reported at the Bristow Oklahoma Mesonet weather station 4 miles southeast of Bristow at 9:05 AM. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
